A nevve anatomie of vvhole man aswell of his body, as of his soule: declaring the condition and constitution of the same, in his first creation, corruption, regeneration, and glorification. Made by Iohn Woolton minister of the Gospell. Woolton, John, 1535?-1594.
[4], 52 leaves
By Thomas Purfoote, dwelling in Paules Churchyard at the signe of the Lucrece, Imprinted at London : Anno Dom. 1576.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======
